intro: Knautia arvensis f. ceretanica, commonly known as the Ceretanica knautia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caprifoliaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and tall, branched stems that bear clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as meadows and roadsides. Its flowers are tubular with five lobes, and it produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and its role in supporting pollinators.
